dialogues.text: I was blasted, man. Shit went right outta my head. Aw, man -— Miles goes to the phone and dials, muttering while it rin

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Columbia motherfucker's...think they own my shit? We gonna see. Try releasing it. Go ahead. My lawyer’1ll be on your ass so fast - The phone picks up.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello. Because of the Yom Kippur Holy Day, Columbia Records will be closed today, Wednesday, September -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yom fucking Kippur!? Miles slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Wait... Village Vanguard. Junior's playing there tonight, right? Dave checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe catch him at rehearsal?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Come on.  57 (PRE-LAP JUNIOR'S JAM SESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heads upstairs, powering through his aching hip. Da follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come and drink my liquor, freeloading thievin' muthafuckas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stands at a double door, jerks them open -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You ain't driving me around looking like that no more. - his massive closet - hundreds of outfits, shoes, shades hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Dave enter, decked out like we first saw them a the top of the movie, drawing stares from the few setting for the show later, BARTENDER, MANAGER, BUSBOYS, etc...

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Oh, hey! Great to see you, Miles. A busboy walks by with a bus bin with dishes.

dialogues.speaker: BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Aw, man. You said this nigga was dead - Manager shoots daggers at him, turns back to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm not here. The BARTENDER leans over the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (butting in) Hey, Miles, I heard you put it down on that new session y’all did. Miles flashes him a quick look.  58 BARTENDER (CONT’D) My cousin play with your man Larry Coryell sometime. The guy gives Miles a knowing, insiders wink. Miles half acknowledges it, drawn by the sounds of a quintet warming fucking around, running phrases, chord changes, on the Mi composition, "All Blues" (bootleg version) - the trumpet player is where Miles' ear goes - clear, bright sounds... something... The bandstand just out of sight... Comes round the bend and sees Junior on the bandstand - M is stopped in his tracks, the quintet is great, but he's truly captivated by the virtuosity of Junior. Dave is blo away by the kid, goes to comment to Miles, stops, seeing differently now, ‘Miles appreciating greatness’, somethin new. The band is having a good time, laughing as one or anothe calls out rapid chord changes - trying to one up each oth as the players have to catch on/up to the changes - but n Junior - he's right there, a monster, not only keeps up, anchors the band, bringing the music back around on the s like Kelly Slater killing it on the wave of a Tsunami - .

dialogues.speaker: PIANO PLAYER
dialogues.text: G flat -

dialogues.speaker: SAX PLAYER
dialogues.text: I can do that -

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Uh huh -

dialogues.speaker: BASS PLAYER
dialogues.text: Cc minor - The drummer switches from 4/4 to 3/4 time.

dialogues.speaker: BAND
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: D - double flat --

dialogues.speaker: PIANO PLAYER
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: BASS PLAYER
dialogues.text: Ahhhh - yeah -

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER
dialogues.text: Wait, what key is this in -  59 Watch those "speed skaters" whip around the musical bend, and lightening fast - "All Blues" has been de-constructed reconstructed, and turned inside out - these guys are fly

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: B flat - Junior blows a bright clear solo, then takes over the son suddenly blasting the punch-line to the joke - quotes the musical phrase, "Anything You Can Do I Can Do Better", to loudly, non-musically, and they all lose it, cracking up ECU - Miles' hand, fingers, they start to twitch almost imperceptibly but it's there. Ghost fingering keys. We he the - whoosh, whoosh, whoosh of Miles' pulse as it slows. hand flinches, clinches shut as if zapped by electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE: Miles with his quintet - "Blue in Green (3:28)" Miles blows through his solo, meditative, focused. The so sounds like an apology for an argument gone unheard. We l this great music play. Others are present but Frances is about the only thing we clearly see - shimmering, illuminated, sipping a martini, silently accepting his musical mea culpa. The rest of the falls off into near darkness, a cigarette tip here, the g of a glass there, smoke throughout the room... Miles finishes his solo and Bill Evans comes in to tie a on it. Miles takes off the mute, puts his trumpet on the stand, strolls off stage, lights a cig. The audience cheers and he and Frances lock eyes for the briefest of beats, when a blonde beauty, looks rich, ERIC 34, steps into his line of vision, blocking Frances.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Hi Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Erica, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Would you walk me out and help me get a cab? I don't feel it's safe for a girl out there by herself. Miles looks over at the stage.  60

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Y’all play that bossa. Miles glances back to Frances, half shrugs. Frances’ face a cipher, giving up nothing. She casually takes a cigaret out of a pack and gracefully holds it, suspended in air f the all too willing nearby gentleman to light.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon... Frances takes a drag, sips her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks Erica across the street to catch a cab.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. When you play like that...it's as if I can hear the words even though no one's singing, you know what I mean? It's like a transfusion of life I feel all throughout my body. She swoons, nuzzling close, whispering the adorations in ear. He doesn't reciprocate, but he doesn't fight her off either. She's welcome to touch, but she can't own. Miles holds up his arm to hail a cab. Frances is at the door of the club, fresh drink in hand, looking at Erica hanging off Miles. A BEAT COP, 45, white, across the street watches Miles an Erica - something doesn't feel right to the cop. Somethin just doesn't like. Frances turns back inside the club. A cab stops. Erica puts her hand in Miles' hand, ever the lady, and he, ever the gentleman, as he helps her into th cab, she reaches into her purse and goes to hand Miles a bill (the way it used to be) - she's sweet, a couple year back he'd take it - he holds up his hand -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Naw, baby, I'm good, I got it. Miles takes a $20 out and hands it to the cabbie. She loo at Miles, with a call-me-anytime look -  61

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Maybe you want to come by later.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Good night, Erica. Miles taps on the cab and it drives her away. He lights a smoke. The cop crosses the street. Miles watches him approach. W does this motherfucker want? A white MAN in a suit down the block takes notice -

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: No loitering. Move on.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I work in there, man.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: I don't care where you work. Move.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm taking a smoke break. I'm Miles Davis. That's me on the marquis.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: I don't a give a shit. Move your ass off this corner now or I'll lock it up.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm on public property, man. I can stand here and have a smoke. The cop takes hold of Miles. Miles pulls away. Then leans into the cop, like a boxer, fists instinctively rising wh he thinks the cop's about to hit him. The cop stumbles ba while going for his cuffs and nightstick. And at that moment, Miles is cracked on the back of the h with a nightstick courtesy of the white man in the suit - turns out to be a PLAINCLOTHES COP. Miles stumbles - dazed, weaves but doesn't go down, bleed from the head, runs down his face - Detective Plainclothe cracks him a second time, then he goes down. The cops rough him up while he's down on the sidewalk. CL ON Miles as he absorbs the punishment. Mr. Plainclothes cuffs Miles and yanks him up as a small crowd (20 people) starts to form.  62 He flashes his badge, voices yelling: "Stop it, stop it!" "That's Miles Davis." "Fucking cops!" Etc. Frances, and a few others, rush out of the club. All happening so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is lead in roughly by the cop thrown in the tank. M plunks down on the bench. Defiant. Wears the blood on his face like war paint. I'm Miles Davis. Fuck you. We HEAR t din of people/reporters outside the jailhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits with his head in his hands, the beating, surroundings, the utter lack of solemnity. Suddenly, outs the cell we hear a loud argument. He looks up, the blood dried on his face -

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...Do you have any Goddamn Listen lady, you better watch worldly idea what you've your - done?! I said, let him out of that cell! That's Miles Davis in there. Miles. Davis. You dumb cracker, mutha - Miles rubbernecks, through the bars and down the corridor sees a sliver of his muse, love, savior, on a tear, at wa for him - he laughs, yeah, baby -

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Better watch my what?! You gonna beat me too, you son-of-a - bitch!?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Ha, check those motherfuckers... REVERSE ANGLE - ON Frances blowing up at the cops - a cou stand back and watch, a couple pass by wanting to "take t bitch's fucking head off", but the presence of Miles' law HAROLD LOVETT, 40s is her protection.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: We're gonna sue the shit out of all you racist sons of bitches. Tell ‘em, Harold -  63

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: The whole damn police department! Frances brushes past the cops, comes up to the cell, peer in, her beautiful face framed by the bars -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles sits in the tub staring at the water. White candles adorn the room, flickering light, (*sounds of Chopin fill house), wine, the mood set. The door opens and Frances co in wearing a robe. She drops it to the floor; Whoa. Franc slides into the tub behind Miles. She wets the soap and starts washing him, gently, lovingly, his wounds, the dri blood. Miles closes his eyes, surrendering to it. She whispers in his ear, sexy, close...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: It’s ok. I got you. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Baby, I want you to stop dancing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I want you to stop dancing, Fran.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: (disbelief - check) You want me to quit West Side.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Quit dancing altogether. She stiffens, straightens, he sits up, turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. It's a sacrifice. But you're my wife now. Your place is with me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Sacrifice. She looks at him askance, giving him a moment to take it back; yet knowing he meant exactly what he said. She lets a little laugh, calling his crazy-town and raising him a crazy-town —  64

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, baby. Love is sacrifice. Let's do this: I'll hang up my dancing shoes, you hock your horns, we'll move to Rome and open a little Trattoria. Just the two of us. Yes. I like that. - hoping he'll fold. Miles is a statue. She leans into hi eyes closed for a beat, then gets out of the tub. Frances slips on her robe, disappears into the darkened bedroom beyond. Miles left behind in the tub, vulnerable, exposed, unanswered. CLOSE UP: The look on Miles' face slowly changes - a glow coming on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior/Quintet on stage Junior finishes his solo, killed rubs the back of his head, sits, looks up, remorse creepi in. Junior peers into the darkness - "Is that...?" Miles stares at him - extracting the truth. Junior realiz "Oh shit." Junior steps off the stage like he’s coming to over to ta then bolts, runnning through a SIDE DOOR. Miles and Dave give chase but Miles' is hobbling - he'll never catch Junior - he holds out the gun to Dave -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No-no, we don't need that - Miles smashes the gun into Dave's hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Go. Get him! Go! Dave chases after Junior. Miles hobbles behind. The band starts to follow but Miles goes sorcerer on them, holds o his hand in a crazy claw shape as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay! They freeze.  65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior hits the exit door but the thing won’t budge. When turns Dave is running up, inadvertently cornering this panicked kid with the gun, the busboy stacking boxes seek cover.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: JR
dialogues.text: So what, you gonna shoot now me over a fucking tape?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What? No, man, he just wants to talk - Not shooting? Great. Junior throws a crushing right hook, connecting with Dave's jaw- Dave stumbles backward - drop the gun - it goes skittering off. Junior hits him again - Dave smashes into stuff, recovers, lands two solid punche Junior, stunning the kid, pleasing himself. Junior return with a combo that lays Dave out. Junior picks up the gun, stands over Dave (like Miles sto over Dave with a gun at their initial meeting at the hous when Miles comes up behind Junior and puts cold steel to back of Junior's head - his mouthpiece. Junior stops cold

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, be cool... - Miles reaches around and takes his gun back from Junior Junior turns to see Miles - and that he just got played w that mouthpiece. Damn. Miles pushes him in his back and h goes tumbling into some boxes in the corner out of breath Miles closes in, Dave flanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Where the fuck's his music, man?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Lie to me, I'll kill you. Junior let's out a sigh, a deep, guilty sigh.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I got it. But I swear, Mr. Davis, I was just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Don't tell me the lies you tell yourself. You're a hype. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can see that shit in your eyes. George put you up to this.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Geor- ? No, Harper just thought - Waitaminute, first lemme tell you something - This cat right here is a crook, Mr. Davis. He was gonna -—

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Ha! Says the thief.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You're the fucking - Mr. Davis, believe me, he's -—

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. What Harper give you to snatch my music? Junior stammers, feeling stupid.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a... a chance to maybe get to work with you, you know. Help you come -- back.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Right. ‘Cause you just the hype with the heart of gold, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (salty) Yeah. You remember that move, right? Miles gestures to the door with the .38 and the trio head toward the stairs, Dave and Junior glaring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band, crowded around the door scurry back, clearing a path for the three guys. Junior goes to the stage, grabs horn and case.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: And don’t play E flat over that D9.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Huh?  67

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You played E flat over that D9.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: So don’t. That’s Dm9. And only sometimes. Junior snaps his case closed, looking irked.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I can play Eb there, it’s just a voicing thing.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Man, you don’t know shit. Miles pushes Junior toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sketchy hood. Jaguar parked at the curb. Miles, Dave and Junior get out. Passing a couple drunks paper-bagging it, a TAGGER, hitting up Dali-esque Miles, prettying up the grime. Seminal Hip-Hop coming out of windows, or is that modern Jay-Z on the reel to reel? Miles, Dave and Junior enter the rundown building -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take the stairs. Junior puts his key in the door and opens it - enters the apartment with Miles and Dave. INT. JUNIOR'S APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS The place is a little ransacked. Hear CHERYL (2 year-old girl) crying in the bedroom. Junior quickly heads into th bedroom leaving Miles and Dave. Miles’ head cocks almost imperceptibly, an inexplicable s of familiarity; these threadbare surroundings, the cacoph of smells and sounds, the chili spaghetti on the stove - coagulated, somebody didn’t make it home for supper; one empty bowl of the stuff on the table, and a dirty highcha drawn with browning flung bits of it. And a cockroach scurrying across the light into darkness.  68 The crying kid, the conversation between Junior and Irene becoming a movement inside an unfolding composition - ON MILES, and on his POV of Junior in the doorway of his bedroom - talking to his wife, IRENE, 24. All we see are legs, sitting in a chair, comforting Cheryl in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: What happened? Irene doesn’t answer -—

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Irene! She doesn’t need to speak; looking around, it hits Junior disappears from the doorway. Hear him rummaging. Crash, b Irene never raises her voice - she’s past that.

dialogues.speaker: IRENE
dialogues.text: It’s not in there. He took it. Junior reappears in front of her, whirling - fuck!

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Harper? (he knows it) Muthafucka.

dialogues.speaker: IRENE
dialogues.text: The other one...muthafucka.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (seething) He sent Walter? ON MILES - Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) -- Did he touch you? He didn’t lay a hand on you. Is she - Reeling, Junior drops to one knee to comfort his daughter but Irene pulls Cheryl close to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: IRENE
dialogues.text: This ain’t all about you, Junior. Junior drops his head in shame. IRENE (CONT’D) What’s wrong with you, man?  69 Irene stands - IRENE (CONT’D) C’mon, Cheryl, mama’s gonna change your diaper. - exits the room with Cheryl.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Irene, I'm sorry... Rene? Irene spots Miles and Dave down the hall. Stops. Her ener changes when she looks at Miles. Recognition, or somethin else? Miles just stares back. A strange moment. Irene goe into the bathroom with Cheryl. Junior enters the room - h hands upturned, like a kid caught with his pants down.

dialogues.speaker: MILES DAVE
dialogues.text: Where's my shit? Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Dave) I'll break your fucking jaw right now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'll fix everything.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (at Junior)

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (snaps to, answers Miles) Harper's got it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured that part out. Where is he? Junior checks the clock on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. His studio, I guess. Miles pushes the phone over.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Call him. Tell him you're coming over.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I can’t just walk in there with you, man. He’s gonna kill me.  70

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You don’t do what I say, I’m gonna kill you. Junior sighs, picks up the phone. Starts dialing, looks o at his trumpet case - ANGLE - it looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I’ll take y’all over there... but I gotta do something first. Miles knows exactly what he means.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Harper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Junior's horn go into the shop window as he walks the front, mouthpiece in hand. He gives the horn a sidewa glance, then walks toward the Jaguar parked outside. Off screen a phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Junior.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You sent Walter to my house? Junior hops in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JAGUAR
dialogues.text: A different street, car running, the window cracks and a reaches in holding two balloons.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You didn’t deliver the tape last night, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I got...held up.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Oh, held up? Held up. Oh, okay, then everything’s fine. Junior exchanges money for the drugs but before he can po them, Miles grabs his arm. Junior grabs Miles' hand like he'll tear it off - that's his life's blood in that rubbe  71

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: This ain't fly away time, we got work to do. Miles snatches one balloon away and Junior lets his arm g

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My mistake. See you later, barwalker.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Waitwaitwait - I blew it, I know. Just lemme just come by - talk man to man. I can put in some work on the music, too, you know. (beat) Give me another shot, Harper, please.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (beat. He chortles) Come and get it. Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JAGUAR
dialogues.text: Miles and Dave lean on the car. Dave looks back, peeks in Junior ties off.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Jesus... shouldn’t we...say something, man?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Go ahead. In the car, CLOSE ON JUNIOR, a rapturous look of instant relief on his face. The pulse slows. We hear it, (sounds Miles' when he saw Junior play), whooosh, whooosh, whooos Time slows. Junior inhales deeply -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a harsh SNORTING - then MILES' (37) head jerks in frame, wiping his nose after doing a bump of coke.  72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles heads DOWNSTAIRS, eyes dilated, trying to focus. Frances is on the phone, a little miffed, a little drunk, and looking at decorating swatches, to further gild her c

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Listen, listen, this is way too complicated. Just tell everybody to meet at Diahann's and I'll teach one big class, okay.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Miles joins the 2nd great quintet (young guys) who are messing around, warming up. HERBIE HANCOCK on piano, RON CARTER on double bass, TONY WILLIAMS on drums, and Wayne Shorter on tenor saxophone. Miles picks up his trumpet and they play, "Nefertiti" a little quick. They soar. As Miles solos, in the deepest thrall of it, the reflection of a RED LIGHT starts FLASHI on his face - we don't get it, but Miles does - it's the phone silently ringing - but that’s not what breaks his concentration - he cuts it off, band stops -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: It’s too fast. Miles starts counting it off, about to play when, (a coup seconds after the blinking red light went off), the angry voice of Frances upstairs breaks through:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is this?! No, he is not! Who the hell is this calling my house?! (Etc. ) Miles, frustrated, grabs the phone. Dialogue overlaps:

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What’s going on, Fran - ?

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hi Miles, it’s Peggy, I -

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi Miles?!

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: - just called to say hi, I didn’t mean to -  73

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to?!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Both of you - hang up the - Frances is still going off at Peggy. Miles hangs up the phone. Counts it off for the band -

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep going. Miles heads upstairs. The band continues sans Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frances is railing at Peggy when Miles storms in. She's drinking - near empty bottle of wine, a glass next to her and a broken glass on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you bitch, don't ever call here again - Miles snatches the phone from her, hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Why you doin’ that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Why am I -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I told you, don’t worry about nobody else.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: This is my house, Miles! My house! Don't have them call my fucking house!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I didn’t tell nobody to call here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: It’s too much, Miles. It’s too much.  74

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Then just don't answer the phone, Frances.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: My, God... Oh, my God... Did you just say that to me...?! Frances starts pacing like a caged tiger, then stops and turns to face Miles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I make your life beautiful, Miles. I take care of you, feed you, lie down in that...fucking bed next to you and -- You're my husband! You're with me. I gave up everything for you. I stopped, dancing, for Godssake. And you haven't sacrificed anything. Nothing. I deserve better than this! His face gives away nothing. She will crack that fucking cool. She picks up knick knacks and starts throwing them dangerously close to his head. Deliberate.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fraud. Phony. Asshole. Liar. Miles barley sidesteps each piece.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You better stop throwing shit, Fran. You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: I'm amazing. She does a slow turn so he can see.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And your friends, your so-called friends, let me know it all the time - A flash in his eye (she's lying) turns to contained rage (she's not lying), she sees it, knows him, digs deeper -

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - wanted me so bad -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Who?  75

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: They come knocking when you're not around, whispering sweet to me, telling me how much better they would treat me than you-

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Who you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter who! I'm not you, Miles. And what do I get -- "Hey, baby, it's one of your whores. When am I going to see you again?" A beat. Miles could apologize...if he could.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Then don't answer the phone. She slaps him, full attack mode, pulling hair, swinging, athletic, a dancer who's sinews haven't been fueled by passion in a while, awakening. Miles is trying to hold he off - the boxer knows defense is offense and somewhere in melee, Miles snaps, and slaps her across the face!

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop! It hurts, in all ways, they both know it, feel it, but Frances only barely reacts, keeps swinging, coming forwar He grabs a fistful of blouse, pulls back to strike France again and they both go tumbling sideways over a coffee ta Loud crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players react to the sound upstairs, quietly vamp. To an 18 year old kid, puts down his sticks concerned, start come from around his drum set. Ron, older, wiser -

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (a warning) Tony... Tony sits, starts playing softly.  76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy breathing from both of them, Frances stands over Mi as he grits his teeth to stand - can’t quite manage yet, hip again, throbbing. Frances doesn't offer to help. Is t a smile? Long pause as Miles stands, extricates himself from the rubble, straightens his clothes, hair. He turns, goes... An ashtray whizzes by his head and smashes into the wall. Miles just keeps walking. Frances puts her face in her hands and weeps.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Miles enters. You can faintly hear her weeping upstairs u the door closes. He’s looking at his band, “are you my ‘s called friends'?”

dialogues.speaker: HERBIE
dialogues.text: You okay, Miles? Miles glares at Herbie. He could kill somebody, or he cou pick up his horn, which he does - sees Frances on the "Someday My Prince Will Come" gold record framed on the w He blows fire. Fueled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty bottle of wine and a glass on the night table. Frances wakes in bed from a nap, surrounded by presents. Emerald ring, sapphire bracelet, mink coat, clothes... Miles is peeking around the circular wall quietly watchin her... She spots Miles and when she turns further, he sees her b eye, it jolts him.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: There's a... necklace in there. Frances nods, cold, unmoved by the gifts - shell shocked.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Wanna go out? Dinner...dancing, or something?  77 Dancing? He didn't even hear it. Frances did. A dagger, reminding her of everything she gave up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: You don't like to dance.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You do. He makes it worse.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... (then touching his eye, referring to hers) Maybe you wanna... put ona little... make-up or something... Miles comes in, picks up the ruby choker and moves behind Frances, gently brushing aside her hair and clasping the thing on her. Love and ownership at the same time. Miles behind her on the bed and pulls her back into him, the bl red droplets suspended in platinum laying on Frances'. Mi rubs his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior rubs his neck, getting focused, standing outside t small warehouse/studio. He pushes the buzzer. Miles and D are hanging back, away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER/INTERCOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: It's Junior. Junior is buzzed in - Miles and Dave push in behind him, staying low to avoid the security camera -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Dave following Junior across the gangplank, ove the atrium. Dave looking none to sure. They enter the out office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Dave enter, Miles keeping Junior in front of hi cautiously looking about.  78

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Boy’s got a glass jaw, Harper, I’m telling you. K.O. round 3.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Walter, you are dumb but at least you're pretty. I love taking your action... Miles pushes Junior into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is the low rent version of Miles' home recordin studio. Photos of Harper with music stars, fighters, movi stars, framed on the wall. Miles’ tape in the valise is o the console behind Harper’s desk. Walter sits in a chair. "Go Ahead John" plays on the radio, Miles Davis Marathon. Before Walter can react Miles has his gun pointed 6 inche from his head. Everyone knows the score. Harper, dressed the nines, looks at Junior, the turncoat.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (resigned and ashamed) They made me do it, man. I - Harper puts up a quieting hand, all the while staring at Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (to Dave, re: Walter) Get his gun. Dave looks at Miles like, “why I do I always gotta take t gun?” Dave grabs Walter’s gun out of his waistband half points it at Walter. Miles points his gun at Harper takes few steps toward him.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Easy... - holds his coat open, shows he's not armed. Miles spots valise and tape. Moves toward them, gun trained on Harper Harper sits on the edge of his desk, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is great. (points at Junior and Dave) Junkie and the flunky.  79

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Fucking Larry and Moe...

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Love them. Miles snatches his valise - makes sure it's all in there

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, guess you're not gettin' 'em either, huh, Rolling Stone? Miles pauses, checks Dave, second time he's been called o Dave scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you and this kid's story. Tryin' to lump me in that shit. Miles continues to stare at Dave -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Harper starts to laugh -

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Damn. This is your boy? Ha! Yeah, you go ahead and take that tape.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (zips the valise) I just did, muthafucka...

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: And that's the second time you pointed a gun at me, you know?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I can count.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Right. I almost forgot - you used to be a musician.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL SCHAFF ON RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was Miles Davis, "Go Ahead John" from the Jack Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You did this for George?  80

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I'm an enterprising young man. I got options. Miles and Dave back out of the room, Junior starts to go them -

dialogues.speaker: MILES HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the fuck you think you’re Where the fuck are you going going? Junior stops in his tracks, sonned by both of men.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See you ‘round, Miles. Miles eyes Junior as he goes, “You brought this shit on yourself.” No denying that. Miles shuts the door behind t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Dave quickly move across the gangplank. Dave ch the gun into the atrium below.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (referring to Junior, low) Your boy here got us fucked up a little bit... Harper's hand flies out to side, grabs the desk lamp LIGH BULB, and squeezes the hot glass into his palm - then wri the life out of the lamp. Junior’s like “shit” that could me. Harper turns back his visage is calm.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: (little heartbroken) Man, I really don't ever want to see that motherfucker again. He goes into his desk, tosses Walter another burner.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go bring me back that goddamned tape. Walter gives him the briefest of looks, nods, checks the  81

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go, Junior. Junior obeys, Harper handling him roughly, pushing him ou side door. Walter books it out the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reprise "Go Ahead John" on the SOUNDTRACK as it builds... Miles strides purposefully toward the Jaguar, Dave in lockstep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You're not saying you bought all that bullshit back there.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Dave, gimme my keys. Dave doesn’t do anything. Miles stops, turns, glares.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Fuck... Alright, alright, but let me just say one thing; I never wanted the tape, okay? Just the story. I was trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: That's three things. Now, gimme the fucking keys! Miles starts ripping at Dave's coat pockets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay - Dave starts to pull out the keys, but before he does - Cl clink, glass bottle. Miles and Dave turn as Walter tries hug the shadow, but knows he’s been clocked -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’m not playing with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: C’mere, Miles. Let me talk to you a second. Miles and Dave sees the glint of Walter’s gun barrel. Mil pulls out his gun -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Let’s go, man.  82 Dave runs to the Jaguar, unlocks the door and hurriedly j in. He reaches over, pops the lock.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Miles slowly walks backwards toward the car, pointing his in Walter’s direction, pops off a shot next to his head, Walter drops left, taking cover behind some cars.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (trying to start the car -— to Miles) The fuck, come on! Dave is frantically pumping the gas, torquing on the ignition. Miles jumps in the car.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Go, go, go! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm doing it! Walter runs back, jumps into a black TOWNCAR at the curb, guns it. The Jaguar roars to life as Dave finally gets going and b rubber out of there.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MILES' JAGUAR
dialogues.text: "Go Ahead John" builds on the TRACK - into "the heist has taken a bad turn let's get the fuck out of here" music. We've come full circle - Reprise the OPENING SHOOTOUT SCENE... (*** in the course of this to be choreographed c scene Miles will run out of bullets). Miles in Jag, Walter in his car, exchanging gunfire, Jag ahead - Dave ADLIBING: "Fuck, shit, etc” -- Walter gainin

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Shoot, muthafucka!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I tossed it!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?!!  83

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING HAPPEN
dialogues.text: Screech-screech - the cars jockey for position -Miles sho across Dave out the window at Walter -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuck me! Walter's car falls back, Miles leans way out the passenge window, pops off a couple more. Walter drops further back evading -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck! Get back in the car, Miles!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Go right! GO RIGHT! Dave guns right - Walter drives straight past, brakes - o sight... Dave and Miles zooming under train trestles - plowing int pile of boxes, fishtailing, papers from the boxes flying. Everything “slows down” in an extended impressionistic be from Miles' POV CAMERA moving around the Jag...Dave screaming at Miles -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (Go! Go! Miles! Miles!...etc.) But Miles, “elsewhere”, can’t hear Dave...PUSHING IN ON MILES, watching what is clearly now staff paper flutterin down all around them, and Miles “composing” ---

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Duh - duh - da - dee - da...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Dave finally snaps Miles back into reality, squealing out the fishtail, as Walter is racing back at them in his car Dave loses control - the Jaguar SKIDS toward the wall - Bullets pierce the Jaguar's body - one SLAMS into MILES' THIGH, he howls in pain as the car screeches to a halt, n a MEAT PACKING WAREHOUSE -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 Miles and Dave scramble out of the car as the Towncar bea down on them. Miles clutches his valise, shooting at the oncoming car - Walter swerves. Dave and Miles head into a ALLEY... The Towncar screeches to a stop near the Jaguar. Walter j out, gun drawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles trips, drops the briefcase, the tape and staff pape spill out. The tape in the can rolls away - Miles tries t for it, Dave drags him to safety behind a dumpster, Miles grasping helplessly at the air, at the papers flying away THEIR POVS behind the dumpster (Miles struggling to break free of Dave) - Walter snatches up the tape and the valis

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (hollering at Walter) Leave it! No!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (holding Miles back) Forget about it -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (at Walter) Don’t do that! Miles shoots at Walter - click-click empty gun.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (at Walter) (to Miles) LEAVE IT! Gonna get us killed, man! Miles, in an impotent last ditch, throws his gun at Walte it barely leaves his hand (with Dave all over him), bounc off the dumpster, and back at Miles. Walter never utters a sound in the scramble, calm, doing job, as if Miles can’t be heard or seen, barely a flea. SIRENS heard in the distance... approaching. Miles can no only watch as Walter hustles out of the alley, hops in his car and bone out. Miles gritting his teeth in pain, staring straight a - “now what?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 Harper reaches back toward Walter, snaps - Walter puts tw fight passes in his hand - holding out the passes to Mile

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: I got a boxer on the card at the Cathedral tomorrow night...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Dave starts to hustle Miles into the passenger seat but h pushes off, heads to the driver’s side -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Your hip, man. Shouldn’t I - Miles ignores him, starts up the car. Dave climbs in the passenger set. Miles races from the scene in the same direction as Walter.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JAGUAR
dialogues.text: Miles eases around the corner, spots Walter's empty car i the alley, and parks next to it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Jesus, just go make some more shit up! You're Miles fucking Davis!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’m getting my goddamned music back- He opens the door and starts to get out. Dave grabs him, Miles pulls away -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Listen, Miles, that’s it. You’re on your own. This is mad. Miles snatches a coat from the back seat -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not dying for this music cuz that’s what’s going to happen if you go in there. You hear me? He's gonna kill you. Miles pulls the coat on as he gets out of the car, when h leg hits the ground, a sharp pain shoots up his leg.  86

dialogues.speaker: MILES DAVIS
dialogues.text: SPLIT SECOND CUTS: Stock footage of a bloody hip operatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1966. A dark black hand holds three white pills. Miles po the painkillers back, chases them with a big slug of cogn He's sweaty, hurting, fucked-up fish-eye style. A cane sitting next to the bed. Miles pulls down his waistband a looks at the bandages on his hip. He painfully bends and straightens his leg, curses under his breath. On the TV an innocuous comedy/laugh track. It's all enoug make you want to kill somebody. Miles grabs the remote, t down the volume. It's faint, but there it is again - laughter. A man's. Followed by another sound; a flirtatio giggle... A woman now whispering - "Stop it, he's going t hear us..." Miles pushes himself up, straight backed. Cal

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Frances...? Hey, goddamnit...! Miles whistles loudly. No response. Miles breath quickens eyes burn. He grabs the cane and swings his leg around th side of the bed, forces himself to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets out of the car, standing, painfully strides to the line of people waiting to get into The Cathedral. Dav gets out of the car, can’t believe what he’s seeing, watc him go. Miles moves through the crowd, patrons' expressions quick shift from piqued to geeked as this reclusive celebrity pushes past them right to the front of the line. Miles wa right up to the door but the DOORMAN there stops him.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Hold it, buddy, hold it... You see that line- His words die in his mouth as it begins to dawn on him wh this is. Miles says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s Miles Davis, man.  87

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: (recognizing) Oh, yeah. Of course. Mr. Davis. I'm sorry...your ticket? Miles points to his world famous face.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You looking at it. - and as Miles rolls into church, Ding Ding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So What" '64 (Miles in Berlin) on the TRACK. Inside The Cathedral, smoky, shadowy, a well worn boxing ring ploppe the center, bleachers surround, a couple hundred people i here...maybe. It’s hard to tell. Not well lit except for ring. In the seats we only ever see small groupings. Folks flow in and out of the aisle, getting beers, but mo hurrying back to see the fight; A BLACK AND WHITE MAN in ring, middle weights, scrappy, not scared to mix it up. R 3, you can see it on the card the girl carries as she cli out of the ring, Ding- Ding... Miles looks left, right. POV back from wide; nobody. Mile looks to the left. Harper up there, Junior next to him. H ducks back into the shadows. Whoosh-whoosh-whoosh in his as he studies his prey. And in an instant Miles doubles o and throws up in a nearby WASTEBASKET.

dialogues.speaker: BEFORE
dialogues.text: "So What" '64 growing on the TRACK. Miles hobbles down th hallway, head on a swivel, searching, his gait made all t more crazy by his injury, paranoia, mounting rage.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Frances...! Miles reaches the bathroom, pushes open the door finding Frances putting on make-up.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: What?  88 Miles looks inside the room, the shower curtain. Frances knows this dance.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Miles- He grabs her arm. Shit... here we go.

dialogues.speaker: BEFORE
dialogues.text: "So What" '64 on the TRACK. Miles drags Frances down thos stairs, those legs and those stairs, no love here now tho or love on kilter, worse.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Let go of me, Miles, goddamnit! She fights him, scared to, scared not to. Miles almost ca hear her, inside steeling himself for the rival he's goin kill before he kills Frances. And on a bad leg too? Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Tell me where he is!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: There's nobody here, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Don't give me that shit. I HEARD him! He drags her toward the kitchen, pulls out a drawer, too CLATTER, cutlery spills everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Miles-

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (crazy) Shhhhhhhbhhh... Miles cocks an ear, listens for a crazy beat then impulsi moves the cutlery aside with his bare foot, bends down an picks up a butcher knife.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll kill his ass! Come on!  89

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Miles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles straightens up, moves into the room, cutting throug the people, headed in Harper’s direction. He cuts back against the grain, calculating a pursuit angle on the fly that he can... what?! "So What" '64 on the TRACK. In the aisle of the bleachers Walter leans across Junior, speaks quietly to Harper. Har covers but he's seething. Junior, wedged between the men, looks sick to his stomach at the news he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: So now I gotta worry about this son of a bitch showing up again or going to the cops?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Cops? (Walter shakes his head, “No.") He shot at me first, Harp. Self defense. And like you said, ain't really his music anyway. Harper looks down at the valise in Walter's hands.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’1ll stay down. He knows what’s up. Harper looks slightly nervous, scans the surroundings a b

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: (low) Don’t fucking count on it... You can say that again. Through the people, Miles stares Harper, stalks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So What" '64 on the TRACK. Miles kicks open a door.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE IS HE
dialogues.text: Frances changes her tactics mid-scream.  90

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Miles, Miles! Oh, my God, he's over there, Miles!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What?! Where?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Down there, down there, he went down there! She points to the basement door. Miles spins his head in direction, drags Frances with him, but she digs in her he knowing what we fear; you go down those steps you might n come back up. Time for crazy-town.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! NO...! Miles, you go get him! I'm too scared! Please. He's a monster! Said he'd kill me if I didn't leave you. The gears collide in Miles brain, teeth chipping off, but his insane state, it works. He re-calibrates.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Muthafucka...! Go upstairs and wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Ok, Miles...okay...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Mutha-fucka... Miles crazy lopes to the door. Frances turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Harper quietly, intensely digging into Walter's as

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Take this tape to the safe, sit there and don't move 'til I - Harper stops mid-sentence seeing Miles coming. Junior sit taller, “WIF?” Walter follows Harper's gaze, peeps Miles, reaches inside his coat.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey -  91 But the big man springs up - this is his life right now, a job. He steps past Junior, jerking him aside as he does All Harper can do is stand too.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Easy -

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He’s got a gun, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Not in his fucking hand, take it easy... Miles hasn't dropped a step, lasered in on Harper. SEEN FROM ACROSS THE RING, through the boxers wiping fram it looks like nothing special; people moving to their sea But hold on - THROUGH the boxers wiping frame... PICTURE BLURS...is that MILES and the QUINTET in the distance ON STAGE killing "So What" '64 ?...maybe for a second, as th PAN CONTINUES until we see we are in the CATHEDRAL...stil THE RING, the boxers are going at it, good fight (white h keeps dropping that left when he throws that right hook though... uh-oh)... Miles stomps up the steps, each one a knife in his hip, f feeding fire. He sees the valise near Harper’s feet, Walt gun in his hand. Miles raises his arms ala’ Harper, “I’m armed.” Harper sighs.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t know what the word “lose” means, do you, Miles? Then a distant voice pierces through.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Miles!! Everyone turns seeing Dave running at breakneck speed, carrying a stand-up ashtray, two security guards on his a He smashes his elbow into a FIRE ALARM box, setting it of Miles takes the opportunity of the distraction to sucker punch Harper. Harper rocks back, falling into Walter, Jun knocking them back into others, one RUBBERNECKING DUDE no too happy about it, pushes them back. Harper screams, enraged, dives on top of Miles and they tumble down the stairs.  92 Walter elbows Rubbernecking Dude off of him to go help Harper, kicking that tangential beef off. Here we go... Miles and Harper roll around trading messy blows. Miles reaches into his waistband pulling out his empty .38. Fuc Walter sees it, raises his piece to shoot Miles but Junio sucker-punches Walter from behind and his gun goes off, hitting Harper. Holy shit. Harper falls spins as he falls over off Miles, looking back at Walter, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Harp! Patrons scream, run off in all directions just as Dave arrives, swinging the stand-up ashtray into Walter's jaw, putting him down. Miles yells to Junior, points -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Grab my shit! Junior runs back up and grabs the valise swimming through crowd now in full frenzy. Dave helps Miles to his feet. IN THE RING/JAPAN, Miles finishes his solo, winded, spent alive, the man, the great white hope laid out on his back beneath him, vanilla Sonny Liston, Ali/Miles standing ove him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, Dave and Junior burst out the door into the hallwa moving fast, Miles clutching his tape like a father reuni with his lost child. In a surreal moment, '79 Miles passes '64 Miles chasing a Frances, running in the opposite direction... he looks ba '64 Miles isn't there, swallowed up by the crowd... Miles, Dave, and Junior fling open the side door into the night -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frances bursts through the front door and into the New Yo night, Gone, Gone, Gone... Miles hobbles back up the stairs, screams for all he's wo

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Frances! FRANCES!!! "So What" ‘64 - done.  93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three jump into the Jaguar and Dave fishtails away fr the curb.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JAGUAR
dialogues.text: Dave and Junior check the mirrors and all around, heads o swivel.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Anybody back there?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No, man, we're good, we're good.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: We're good. Beat. Then they start to out-gas, relieved laughter, oblivious to Miles' state in the back.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Ho-ly shit... That was, I mean... I mean, that was -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Miles remains quiet. They finally tune into him.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Miles, we're gonna get you right, man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (almost a whisper) No. Take me home. Junior checks him out, bleeding caked over now. Dave nods tugs on the wheel. Miles stares off as we PUSH IN. Somewhere, a phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?  94

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You thought I wouldn't find you? (silence) If you make me come out there, the only thing left is gonna be bullets. (beat) You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm not coming back. Long beat. Miles breathing.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll... I'll kill myself, Frances. I swear to God. (breathing, then) Frances- - I love you...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know you do. Goodbye, Miles. Click. Dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles enters first, Junior holding the crook of his arm, trailing slightly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'll go find some...gauze, something-—

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. And some alcohol. Clean that shit out. Miles goes to his work area. Junior follows at a respectf distance as Miles threads the tape and hits play. Tape sp through the heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave goes through the sink cabinet looking for supplies, stops, hearing the indecipherable sounds emanating from t other room.  95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave returns with the stuff finding Miles sitting at his station, full concentration, Junior behind him. Dave sidl in next to Junior. They listen, waiting to hear something resembling music. But it's just disorganized noise so far conversations about music, stops and starts, flirtations concepts but nothing concrete. Dave looks at Junior - "Am I missing something?" Junior's look - "Give it a minute." Miles fast forwards the tape but even at it's sped up tem we can tell he's not running over music. He hits stop. Pl Listens. It's more of the same.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: When do you come in?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm already in there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I don't hear any-

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I played organ... Jesus Christ... Dave squints at Junior - "This is it?" Ju looks at his shoes, crushed, witnessing his hero falter. sighs. Hearing the sound, Miles snaps his head around, sees Dave shock, but worse; Junior's look of pity. Pity; Miles Achi heel. Miles stands up, goes to his trumpet case, pops it open. perks up. Miles Davis' first notes after five years? An incredible moment about to unfold. But Junior is unchange horn player knows... Miles returns to his station, spreads out his musical scr He pulls out his mouthpiece, pops it on, holds open the s valve and blows through the dormant instrument. No spit, mist, just dank air. Miles licks his lips, the mouthpiece takes a deep breath... and blows... Nothing. The labored, ragged sound of an atrophied embouc after a five year lay off. He tries to play it off, let's a dark chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn...  96 Miles licks his lips and blows again gets the same result Not funny. Junior looks like he might cry. Miles get piss now, tries to overpower the instrument, blows hard, manag to coax out a squeak. Then silence except for the musical mish mash playing in the background.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Aw, that ain't nothing, man. Hit them scales, right? Your chops come back. Real quick. Junior chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's just like... some practice, right? Their "help", neither solicited nor appreciated, has the opposite effect. Miles looks at his horn, nods gravely an lays it down. There's a long uncomfortable silence as Mil starts to walk away. Junior gently puts his hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You'll get it back, man. Miles digs in his pocket and pulls out the last balloon o heroin he took from Junior earlier. Hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Bye bye. Miles flops down onto the couch. Done. Dave starts chuckl darkly - Junior stares at the baggie in his hand, contemplating. H sits down in front of the spinning reel and the gibberish poring out of the speakers. Miles looks over, finds a half drunk bottle of booze, wip the top of it with his sleeve and then takes it to the he Finshing it off, he let’s out a deep sigh. Dave can’t bel what he’s looking at.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This is not... are you kidding me? Miles clicks on the TV. Focuses on the fight playing ther Dave nods, laughs a long hollow, “How’d I not see this coming,” laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself) What was I thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Miles) Going back in your hole, huh? Guess I should've expected that. It’s a good thing I came prepared. You mind? 97 Dave pulls out his camera. Snaps a shot. Miles squints, finally looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I gotta hunker down too. Got work to do. See, I'm coming out with the fuckin' story, you better believe that. Forget about the comeback piece. It’s dirt time. And I’m coming with it. Dave gestures sprinkling dirt on his grave. Miles swigs a Dave rolls on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rolling Stone passes, so what? Have any idea how many people'll want to buy what I got? You may be a fucking quitter, but you're still an earner, baby. He pops off a shot and Miles chucks the bottle at his hea Dave ducks it quick, guffaws. He pops another picture.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it! But remember, you're Miles Davis! Don’t be repetitive. Switch it up a little bit. I mean, you already did the self-pitying, junkie, jazz burnout, asshole thing, right? Realizing it’s all falling on deaf ears -

dialogues.speaker: FUCK
dialogues.text: Dave plops down into a chair, sick to his stomach. Then, a loud trumpet run cuts through Dave’s rant. Junior, Miles' trumpet in his hand, looking at the deciphering it. Inspired, Junior cuts off the reel and rips another musical phrase, having mined some scrawl, to reel gold. Miles and Dave watch and listen in silence as Junior grab the treasure map ledger pages -  98

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Ima go over to the piano Junior strides over to the piano, reads, plays a few chords...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (squinting at the scrawl) That's what you have here...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: That's not in there...

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (grinning at the scrawl) Yes it is, it's the 5 sus chord... Zooming to the two, Miles walks over, Junior plays a chor with his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Ok -

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: - to the 3rd, f# major, to the tonic minor, to the flat 6 ...B major... Miles puts the mute in the trumpet bell and they figure i out together for a few bars, Junior humming Miles to the right notes also with head movement...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Why don't you change that 2nd chord from f# major to f minor 7?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Ok sooo....like this? Junior plays the progression...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah...start over start over... They play a bit more together...

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah ...see what I'm sayin? Gives it a lil color..  99

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, ok, ok, I see....

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: So, that’s really in there, huh? Miles peeks at Dave a sec, “guess so...” POV from the staircase, someone or something watches the working out. Frances? We hold on the tableau from this vantage point for a beat. Junior nods, plays another chord, Miles blows too, ragged edges ever so slowly smoothing out. Dave walks up to the piano, grabs a pencil from the stand takes a sheet from the pile of staff paper, flips it over starts feverishly writing the story. Stay here until too becomes.

dialogues.speaker: CROSSFADE
dialogues.text: Later now and Junior fades away -

dialogues.speaker: CROSSFADE
dialogues.text: Later now and Dave fades away -

dialogues.speaker: CROSSFADE
dialogues.text: Miles by himself, working it out, his composition taking shape.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So what should we tell the folks, that Miles Davis has mellowed with age or that folks are just now listening to what he's been saying or -

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't tell ‘em nothin'. Let ‘em guess.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You like that, huh? The mystery...

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They like it. I'm cool.  100 INT. MILES’ HOUSE - NIGHT Miles and Junior at the piano. Dave watching. Tableau. Th tableau then goes away - Dali-esque transition - becoming Miles in the interview chair. The wraparound. Trumpet lea Miles’ lips. A beat then.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Dig it. That was a better answer. I was really drawn in. Beautiful playing, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Something clicked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'll say. Great. And is there a way that you can put what you just played into words?" Miles shakes his head, chuckles, rises, puts his trumpet stand, picks up the valise stuffed with staff paper, the record SMPWC tucked in behind the tape cannister, and wal off camera.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Keep rolling... Dave enters frame, turns to the camera, shrugs; “Is he fucking serious?” Dave calls out to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, are you coming back?! Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stage. The band comes on - Gary Clark Jr. Esperanza Spaulding, Wayne Shorter, Herbie Hancock... Miles jumps it all off, stepping up to the mic and firing run, looking good now, strong, back. The band locks in an they begin to run the voodoo down, no one leading, everyo following, searching for all that is said and unsaid, the particles that make up the fabric of life itself.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: 101 Miles finishes his solo and steps to the side to watch. P IN on Miles, you can see it up close, the corners turn up slightly -- Miles Smiles.
